heading: hubbell tapes
subheading: the indicted fob appears in a more favorable light in parts of the prison tapes the republicans had not at first made public. hubbell insists nobody bought his silence and that he "provided services" for presidential benefactors who paid him large sums of money. representative dan burton released more of the tapes after democrats pointed out that their original editing appeared to be intended to embarrass hubbell, the former justice department official and clinton confidant.
author: wired staff
